item.title: Bring Back Natural History
item.description: Yale’s Peabody Museum has reinvented itself.

item.title: Did an AI Write This?
item.description: ‘Hand cybersecurity over to the computers’—seems suspicious.

item.title: But for the Grace of God. . .
item.description: At only nine months older than President Biden, Joe Lieberman died a sudden death from a fall.

item.title: 'Uptime' Review: I'll Get Back to You Later
item.description: If you don’t reply to an email, you’ll get another email followed by a demanding instant chat. Attempts at saving time can end up losing time.

item.title: The Presidency, I'm Against It
item.description: Trump could seek a legacy as the leader who constrained the executive branch.

item.title: China's Flag Is Red, Not Green
item.description: The West has been too willing to believe Beijing’s claim that it cares about the environment.

item.title: Love, Death and Golf Clubs: A Tale of Two Brothers
item.description: When my brother died, he left behind his golf clubs. I wasn’t sure if I could handle playing with them.

item.title: Gaza Cease-Fire Talks to Resume as Netanyahu, Hamas Face Calls for Concessions
item.description: CIA Director William Burns is in Egypt to try to unblock a monthslong impasse.

item.title: Stock Funds Zoom to 9.1% Gain in First Quarter
item.description: Start to year was even better than hoped. Also: A flashback to the 30th anniversary of the Kidder Peabody bond scandal.

item.title: Do Kwon Lost to the SEC. The U.S. Is Piling Up Other Crypto Wins, Too.
item.description: The decision was the latest in a series of federal court wins bolstering regulators’ efforts to force the freewheeling industry to comply with the same laws that govern the stock and bond markets.

item.title: $1.3 Billion Powerball Winning Ticket Was Sold in Oregon After Drawing Delays
item.description: The jackpot is the fourth-largest in Powerball history, with a cash value of $621 million.

item.title: More »
item.description: Finally, a smart twist on one of the stock market&#x27;s dumbest ideas

item.title: Steelworkers Push Back Against $14 Billion Deal for U.S. Steel as Vote Looms
item.description: Nippon Steel is pitching new investment in aging plants to help win the union’s support for the planned deal. Union leaders say they are unconvinced.

item.title: New Urgent-Care Centers Step In to Treat Children in Mental-Health Crisis
item.description: The sites are starting to change the face of mental-health treatment, offering a much-needed alternative to emergency departments that have become strained by an increase in visits during the pandemic.

item.title: The Race to Make a Sexy Fiber Supplement Is On
item.description: Companies are pitching fiber products to young people, and aiming to be the ‘Metamucil for the Stanley cup generation. ’

item.title: Cities Packed Shelters With Migrants. Now They Are Limiting Stays.
item.description: Migrants, many of whom are seeking asylum, face a lengthy road to gain work authorization.

item.title: Solar Eclipse 2024: What to Know About the Sun Going Dark in North America
item.description: When will the total eclipse start? How long will it last? Everything you need to know about the celestial event.

item.title: Generative AI Isn't Ubiquitous in the Business World---at Least Not Yet
item.description: ChatGPT and other tools have racked up users, but some companies are proceeding with caution, or not at all.

item.title: He Wants to Drive a Million Miles in His Porsche. He's Not That Far Off.
item.description: Tom Thalmann recently turned his 700,000th mile in his Porsche 911 Turbo, which he bought new two decades ago and has used as his daily driver ever since.

item.title: Bill Murray's Son Designed UConn's Offense. It's No Joke.
item.description: The Huskies are back in the national title game for the second straight year. They’ve got a legendary comedian’s son—an international hoops junkie—to thank for it.
